title: Kevin Stewart reveals Liverpool stars had to dunk into ice bath for losing six-a-side tournament during La Manga trip
text:
Stewart was forced to take a dunk into a freezing bath (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool starlet Kevin Stewart has been thrown into a freezing bath - after losing an inter-club six-a-side tournament during their mid-season trip to La Manga. 
First team aces Sadio Mane, Adam Lallana, Ragnar Klavan and Nathaniel Clyne were also part of the flops - with keepers Simon Mignolet, Loris Karius, Alex Manninger and John Achterberg taking turns to play in goal. 
Former Tottenham midfielder Stewart, 23, has played nine times for Jurgen Klopp's men this season after spending loan spells at Burton, Swindon and Cheltenham. 
“We ended up bottom so we got launched into a freezing outdoor pool at the hotel as the forfeit,” Stewart told the Liverpool Echo . Stewart turns his back on a Divock Origi strike in La Manga (Photo: Liverpool FC) Stewart jokes with Joel Matip (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
“It was even colder than it looked. I think it doubled up as the ice bath, I opted to jump in before I got thrown in. 
“Ray Haughan (team admin manager) didn’t get that choice. He just got thrown in by the lads.” 
Stewart roomed with Philippe Coutinho during the four-night warm weather training camp and believes taking the players away was a shrewd move by Klopp. 
“It was really good. I really enjoyed it,” he said. 
“It was different to a normal trip away. We definitely got closer as a team. 
“We did a lot of team building stuff and just spending time together was really good. There was a lot of fun and games but I think there was a decent balance with hard work too.
